metadata.Title: CVE-2023-31490 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue found in Frrouting bgpd v.8.4.2 allows a remote attacker to cause a denial of service via the bgp_attr_psid_sub() function.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-31490` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

frr - 8.1-1ubuntu1.4
frr-pythontools - 8.1-1ubuntu1.4
frr-rpki-rtrlib - 8.1-1ubuntu1.4
frr-snmp - 8.1-1ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> code doesn't look to be in quagga

criterions.comment: frr package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1-1ubuntu1.4').
